content:
Work on Operator Ergonomics with regards to referencing appears to have stalled. I'm working on a numerics library and the performance/usability tradeoff of operators with alloc data-types (e.g. variable-length matrices) is rather large.

PR 62: "Initial draft of copy ergonomics design note"
PR 63: "Autoref/autoderef for operators"

  • Is there some workaround that people are currently using to compensate for this issue?
  • Is there outstanding work that doesn't require significant domain expertise? The PR comments seem to be around wording, except for the one where highlighting that autoderef may prevent stack overflows.
At the moment, I think the outstanding work is much less an issue of implementation and much more an issue of design and architecture.
We need a design that teams can agree on and feel comfortable with. I think that's possible, but it'll take time.
